title: Visual Clues
description: Can you identify objects, places, and things from their visual descriptions?

questions.question: I have 88 keys, but I don't open any doors. I am black and white. What am I?
questions.explanation: A piano has 88 keys — 52 white keys and 36 black keys. It's one of the most popular musical instruments in the world.

questions.question: I stand on a tall pole, I display three colors — red, yellow, and green — and I tell you when to stop and go. What am I?
questions.explanation: Traffic lights use red (stop), yellow (caution), and green (go) to direct vehicle and pedestrian traffic safely.

questions.question: I have a magnetic needle that always points north. I show the directions N, S, E, and W. What am I?
questions.explanation: A compass uses a magnetized needle that aligns with Earth's magnetic field to always point toward magnetic north.

questions.question: I have 12 numbers on my face, at least two hands, and I hang on the wall or sit on a table. What am I?
questions.explanation: A clock displays the numbers 1 through 12 and uses hour and minute hands (and sometimes a second hand) to tell the time.

questions.question: I have 64 squares in a pattern of black and white. Kings and queens move across my surface. What am I?
questions.explanation: A chess board has 64 squares arranged in an 8x8 grid of alternating dark and light colors, where pieces like kings and queens compete.

questions.question: I am orange, round, and bouncy. I go through a hoop that's 10 feet high. What am I?
questions.explanation: A basketball is the distinctive orange ball used in the sport where players shoot through a hoop mounted 10 feet above the court.

questions.question: I have four strings and you play me with a bow. You rest me under your chin. What am I?
questions.explanation: A violin has four strings and is played with a bow while being held under the chin. It is the smallest and highest-pitched string instrument in the orchestra.

questions.question: I am tall and stand near the coast. I shine a bright beam of light to warn ships at night. What am I?
questions.explanation: Lighthouses are tall coastal structures that project powerful beams of light to guide ships and warn them of dangerous shorelines.

questions.question: I am a long tube with a lens at one end. I sit on a tripod and help you see the stars. What am I?
questions.explanation: A telescope uses lenses or mirrors in a tube, often mounted on a tripod, to magnify distant celestial objects like stars and planets.

questions.question: I am a sphere that shows all the continents and oceans. I spin on a tilted axis. What am I?
questions.explanation: A globe is a spherical model of the Earth that shows continents and oceans, mounted on a tilted axis to represent Earth's 23.5-degree tilt.

questions.question: I am a thin glass tube filled with liquid that rises and falls. I measure temperature in degrees. What am I?
questions.explanation: A thermometer uses liquid (traditionally mercury) in a glass tube that expands and contracts to measure temperature in degrees.

questions.question: I have two glass chambers connected by a narrow neck. Sand flows through me to measure time. What am I?
questions.explanation: An hourglass uses sand flowing between two glass chambers to measure a fixed period of time, typically one hour in the original design.

questions.question: I have a canopy, a long handle, and metal ribs that open and close. I protect you from rain. What am I?
questions.explanation: An umbrella has a fabric canopy supported by metal ribs on a central handle, designed to shield you from rain or sun.

questions.question: I have letter keys, a moving carriage, and an ink ribbon. I was used for writing before computers. What am I?
questions.explanation: A typewriter uses keys that strike an ink ribbon to print letters on paper, with a carriage that moves across as you type.

questions.question: I have two lenses side by side, a strap to hang around your neck, and a focus wheel. I help you see far-away things. What am I?
questions.explanation: Binoculars have two parallel lenses with a focus wheel for adjustment and a neck strap, allowing you to magnify distant objects for both eyes.
